item.title: Maduro’s Capture Deals Heavy Blow to Cuba’s Vaunted Intelligence Service
item.description: Cuba said that 32 officers assigned to protect Venezuela’s deposed strongman were killed by U.S. forces, signaling trouble for Havana’s own rulers.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Speak Loudly and Carry a Big Stick—Trump’s Approach to the Americas
item.description: The audacious decision to seize Maduro heralds a new geopolitical strategy: The U.S. and the U.S. only will dominate the Western Hemisphere.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Trump’s Hint to Oil Executives Weeks Before Maduro Ouster: ‘Get Ready’
item.description: The U.S. president now wants oil companies to grow Venezuela’s production.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Wall Street Investors Who Stuck With Venezuela Are Poised for a Payday
item.description: Many who hold distressed Venezuelan assets hope that Maduro’s ouster signals a windfall after a long time out in the cold.
item.dc:creator: Matt Wirz

item.title: Citgo Is a Crown Jewel of Venezuela’s Oil Industry. Elliott Is Set to Reap the Benefits.
item.description: The hedge fund could soon close its proposed takeover of the refiner—and profit from any bump in oil production from the Latin American country.
item.dc:creator: Benoît Morenne

item.title: CIA Concluded Regime Loyalists Were Best Placed to Lead Venezuela After Maduro
item.description: President Trump was briefed on an intelligence report that found the country’s opposition would struggle to lead a temporary government.
item.dc:creator: Vera Bergengruen

item.title: Venezuela’s New Leader Rushes to Assert Control After Maduro’s Fall
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez declared a “state of external commotion” and security forces set up checkpoints.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: Opinion | The ‘International Law’ Illusion in Venezuela
item.description: Rogue regimes now use it as a shield to protect their own lawbreaking.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Your Regular Russian Saboteurs
item.description: Russia’s shadow fleet keeps damaging Baltic Sea cables.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | Maduro and the Democratic Socialists
item.description: Zohran Mamdani misses a chance to distance himself from Venezuelan socialism.
item.dc:creator: William McGurn

item.title: Opinion | Japan Should Join the Abraham Accords
item.description: A U.S.-friendly move that would showcase Japan’s relevance.
item.dc:creator: Andrew M. Saidel

item.title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Find insight on oil futures, Venezuela’s oil production and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.

item.title: Maduro Declares His Innocence in First U.S. Court Appearance
item.description: Prosecutors allege the ousted Venezuelan president, his wife and others conspired to import cocaine to the U.S. for 25 years.
item.dc:creator: James Fanelli

item.title: Opinion | Mexico Is Acting Like an Adversary to the U.S.
item.description: Its president denounced Maduro’s capture and has given aid and comfort to dictators and drug cartels.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Treviño

item.title: A Mystery Trader Made $400,000 Betting on Maduro’s Downfall
item.description: The person doubled down Friday with a final bet on Polymarket at 9:58 p.m., shortly before President Trump ordered the military to strike.
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Ostroff

item.title: Venezuela Ushers in the Era of Trump’s ‘Donroe Doctrine’
item.description: Under the president’s version of the Monroe Doctrine, commerce and resources drive U.S. strategic intervention. Is Greenland next?
item.dc:creator: Greg Ip

item.title: An Emboldened Trump Looks Beyond Venezuela
item.description: The president has resumed threats against Colombia, criticized Mexico’s leadership and said Cuba’s government would fall.
item.dc:creator: Meridith McGraw

item.title: Opinion | Four Myths About the Capture of Nicolás Maduro
item.description: And the reality: It was a superbly executed act of strategic opportunism that removed a vexing enemy.
item.dc:creator: Gerard Baker

item.title: Maduro’s Capture Threatens China’s Ambitions in Latin America
item.description: Beijing has steadily built relationships over the past two decades in Washington’s backyard.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Why China Stopped Publicly Urging for North Korean Denuclearization
item.description: Beijing has fewer reasons to alienate Pyongyang, turning down chances to openly back disarmament such as at a state visit by South Korea’s president.
item.dc:creator: Dasl Yoon

item.title: Venezuela’s Men With Guns Remain the Ultimate Power After Maduro’s Ouster
item.description: Diosdado Cabello and Vladimir Padrino command Venezuela’s police and military, and represent a wild card for Trump.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: South Korea’s President Identifies a New Enemy: Baldness
item.description: Leader likens hair loss to a ‘matter of survival’ and is pushing for government support. The debate has parted the country down the middle.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Israel Flexes New Diplomatic Muscle in Recognition of Somaliland
item.description: Two years of war have honed Israeli independence on the world stage.
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: A New Trump Game Plan Takes Shape: Strike and Coerce
item.description: The administration’s reliance on the surprise use of force in Venezuela and other countries highlights a new era of “gunboat diplomacy.”
item.dc:creator: David S. Cloud

item.title: U.S. Plays Down Quick Return to Democracy in Venezuela
item.description: Many Venezuelans welcome the ouster of Maduro, but worry his repressive regime remains in place.
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Venezuela’s New Power Players Emerge After Maduro’s Ouster
item.description: A scrambled order—including de facto Venezuelan leader Delcy Rodríguez—is forming among the U.S., American oil interests and remnants of the old regime.
item.dc:creator: Michael Amon

item.title: Iran’s Calculations Are Scrambled by U.S. Raid in Caracas
item.description: The capture of Nicolás Maduro will force officials in Tehran to consider a broader range of risks as Trump threatens to intervene.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Venezuela’s New Leader Is a Hardline Socialist Like Maduro
item.description: Delcy Rodríguez is known as a political operator, someone Trump said is “willing to do what we think is necessary to make Venezuela great again.”
item.dc:creator: José de Córdoba

item.title: Trump Wants to Unlock Venezuela’s Oil Reserves. A Huge Challenge Awaits.
item.description: The president wants to put Venezuela’s viscous crude into play. The problem is the world doesn’t have much appetite for more oil.
item.dc:creator: David Uberti

item.title: Venezuela’s Maduro Seemed Untouchable. Now He Will Stand Trial in New York.
item.description: U.S. prosecutors must prove that the Venezuelan strongman is the boss of a drug cartel.
item.dc:creator: Sadie Gurman

item.title: Could You Pass South Korea’s English Language Test? Try Our Quiz
item.description: These are the five hardest questions from the country’s notoriously challenging college-entrance exam, a batch of problems so puzzling a top official resigned.
item.dc:creator: Timothy W. Martin

item.title: Why Jihadism Is in Retreat
item.description: Despite isolated terrorist attacks by extremists, political Islam is increasingly taking a more pragmatic approach as its appeal wanes.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: Iran’s Refusal to Dial Back Nuclear Program Lit Fuse on Currency Crisis
item.description: Tehran is sticking with the program despite crippling Western sanctions, as protests continue and President Trump warns against a bloody crackdown.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Kick Off 2026 With A Loss
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures started the year lower with the weather outlook for the second half of winter the main trader focus.

item.title: After Swiss New Year’s Fire, Parents Race to Find Survivors and Identify the Dead
item.description: Badly burned teenagers were sent to hospitals across Europe for treatment; the blaze likely was caused by sparklers, officials said.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Champagne Sparklers Likely Ignited Ceiling in Swiss New Year’s Fire
item.description: Officials are to investigate criminal liability following the blaze in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana that killed at least 40.
item.dc:creator: Nick Kostov

item.title: Modi Taps India’s Consumer Power in Trade Fight With Trump
item.description: The efforts of India’s prime minister to juice consumer spending and bolster the economy are showing signs of success.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: U.S. Slashes Proposed Tariffs on Italian Pasta
item.description: Exporters had feared they would have to pull out of the U.S. market.
item.dc:creator: Margherita Stancati

item.title: Fire at Swiss Ski Resort Kills Roughly 40
item.description: More than 100 people were injured in a fire that broke out at a bar during New Year’s celebrations.
item.dc:creator: Sam Schechner

item.title: Russia’s Strikes on Odesa Aim to Cut Ukraine’s Economic Lifeline
item.description: The deadly attacks on a crucial trade hub have come as the U.S. peace effort continues.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: China Signals It Won’t Give an Inch to the U.S. in Latin America
item.description: Beijing is doubling down on its expansion just as President Trump tries to claim the Western Hemisphere as an exclusive sphere of influence for the U.S.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Xi Says China Hit 2025 Growth Target Despite Economic Headwinds
item.description: The leader’s New Year speech is an opportunity to communicate directly with the Chinese people and provided an insight into his priorities.
item.dc:creator: Chun Han Wong

item.title: Russia Doubles Down on Allegations Ukraine Targeted Putin Residence
item.description: Officials are using the alleged attack as a pretext to threaten retaliation and a tougher stance in negotiations.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Five Takeaways From China’s Military Drills Around Taiwan
item.description: Beijing encircled the island this week and warned outsiders to stay away.
item.dc:creator: Joyu Wang

item.title: China’s Factory Activity Gauges Signal Return to Growth
item.description: China’s factory activity signaled a return to growth in December, according to both official and private surveys, an improvement likely to help Beijing achieve its growth target for the year.

item.title: Ukraine Seeks Decadeslong Security Guarantee as Trump Offers 15 Years
item.description: Kyiv said the guarantee offered by the U.S. would be too short to deter Russia from future aggression.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Trump Says Talks to End Ukraine War Yield Progress Though Hurdles Remain
item.description: The U.S. president offers few specifics after a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin and a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
item.dc:creator: Alex Leary

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia Agree to Immediate Cease-Fire in Border Clashes
item.description: At least 22 civilians—21 in Cambodia and one in Thailand—have been killed since an earlier truce collapsed on Dec. 8.
item.dc:creator: Gabriele Steinhauser

item.title: Trump, Zelensky to Meet on Bridging Gaps in Draft Peace Deal
item.description: The high-level talks come after a flurry of U.S.-Ukraine negotiations, but Russia remains a possible obstacle.
item.dc:creator: Anastasiia Malenko

item.title: U.S. Strikes on Nigeria Targeted Islamic State Camps With Missile Barrage
item.description: The U.S. military said multiple militants had been killed in an attack that again showed President Trump’s focus on deterring violence against Christians.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump’s Inner Circle Sees Russia as an El Dorado for Business, but Pitfalls Abound
item.description: Veteran U.S. investors say Vladimir Putin’s Russia will remain a treacherous business environment.

item.title: U.S. Launched Christmas Day Strike Against ISIS in Nigeria
item.description: The president previously said he would move to protect the country’s Christian population.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: This Dynasty of Watchmakers Outlived an Empire. Can It Survive the Modern World?
item.description: One family’s centurieslong trade provides a window on British colonial history and Kenya’s independence, but its time looks to be coming to a close.
item.dc:creator: Michael M. Phillips

item.title: India Is on a Himalayan Building Spree to Prepare for a Clash With China
item.description: A deadly standoff jolted India to stitch together a huge network of roads, tunnels and landing strips needed to move soldiers and supplies to the mountainous border region.
item.dc:creator: Ming Li

item.title: Senior Libyan Military Leaders Die in Plane Crash
item.description: An army chief and commander of ground forces for the government in Tripoli were among five confirmed killed shortly after takeoff in Turkey.
item.dc:creator: Elvan Kivilcim

item.title: Bondi Beach Terror Suspects Condemned ‘Zionists’ and Amassed an Arsenal
item.description: Court documents reveal what police say were the movements and motivation of Sajid and Naveed Akram.
item.dc:creator: Jon Emont

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Fell, But Challenges Ahead
item.description: The narrower November deficit was largely due to an increase in revenues following the government’s decision to increase a tax on employment.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Bondi Beach Shooting Suspect Charged With Terrorism, Murder
item.description: Police charged 24-year-old Naveed Akram after he woke up from a coma.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: U.K. Inflation Slows to Eight-Month Low as BOE Prepares Rate Decision
item.description: Prices cooled more than expected in November, keeping the Bank of England on course for a fourth interest-rate cut of the year.
item.dc:creator: Ed Frankl

item.title: Bondi Beach Attack Badly Shakes Sense of Safety for Australia’s Jews
item.description: There has been frustration among Sydney’s Jewish community that authorities haven’t heeded warnings about a rise in antisemitism.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Father and Son Used Licensed Firearms in Sydney Terror Attack, Police Say
item.description: The Australian prime minister said the suspects acted alone, as he called for tighter gun controls after the deadly Hanukkah shooting.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: Terrorist Attack Targets Jews at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Killing 15
item.description: The suspects are a father, also killed, and his son, in the shooting at a Hanukkah event.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: Charles III Gives ‘Good News’ on Cancer Treatment
item.description: The British monarch, who was diagnosed last year, said his treatment is due to be scaled back in 2026.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: U.K. Economy Contracts Again, Likely Cementing BOE Rate Cut
item.description: Economic activity dipped 0.1% on month in October. Economists polled by The Wall Street Journal had expected an increase.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Britain Asked a Power Plant to Build a ‘Fish Disco.’ It’s Not Going Well.
item.description: Plans to use a deep-sea boom box to keep fish away from a coastal nuclear station have gone awry. DJing for marine life, it turns out, is a nightmare.
item.dc:creator: Eliot Brown

item.title: ‘India’ and ‘Let My Country Awake’ Review: History at an Audacious Scale
item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.

item.title: Russia and India’s Complicated Relationship Hinges on Oil
item.description: The two countries’ reliance on each other in the energy sector is coming under strain.
item.dc:creator: Tripti Lahiri

item.title: Putin and Modi Deepen Relationship That Has Drawn Trump’s Anger
item.description: The Russian president is embarking on a high-profile visit to India, aiming to protect a partnership that is a crucial for Moscow.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
